text: The 1881–1882 season was the 11th season of competitive football in England. ==National team== England played Ireland for the first time. Their 13–0 victory is still the team's largest ever win. {| class="wikitable" !Date !Venue !Opponents !Score* !Comp !England scorers !Scotland/Wales scorers |- |18 February 1882 |Bloomfield, Belfast (A) | |13–0Ireland v England, 18 February 1882. 11v11.com. Retrieved 5 July 2013 Report on Scotland v England match. London Hearts Supporters Club. Retrieved 5 July 2013 |F |Billy Mosforth (The Wednesday) (30 mins), Edward Hagarty Parry (Old Carthusians) (35 mins) & Henry Cursham (Notts County) (48 mins) |Alfred Jones (o.g.), William Pierce Owen (2), John R Morgan, John Vaughan |} * England score given first † This match constituted Ireland's international debut Key * H = Home match * A = Away match * F = Friendly ==Honours== {| class="wikitable" |- !Competition !Winner |- |FA Cup||Old Etonians (2) |} Notes = Number in parentheses is the times that club has won that honour. * indicates new record for competition ==References== ==External links== * *Report on Scotland v England match on thefa.com *
title: 1881–82 in English football
